Module com.jlbabilino.json
Package com.jlbabilino.json

Class JSONEntry

java.lang.Object
com.jlbabilino.json.JSONEntry
Direct Known Subclasses:
JSONArray, JSONBoolean, JSONNull, JSONNumber, JSONObject, JSONString
public abstract class JSONEntry extends Object

This abstract class is the super class of every type of entry possible in a JSON structure. Each entry class that contains sub-entries always uses this type for those entries.

Here's an example: This is an example JSON file that could be imported into this system:
{
    "people": [{
        "name": "Justin",
        "age": 16
    }, {
        "name": "Joe",
        "age": 23
    }]
}

Let's say that the root object of this has been imported into a variable entry.

Retrieving the name of the first person: 

 JSONObject rootObject = (JSONObject) entry;
 JSONArray peopleArray = (JSONArray) rootObject.get("people");
 JSONObject firstPersonObject = (JSONObject) peopleArray.get(0);
 JSONString nameString = (JSONString) firstPersonObject.get("name");
 String firstPersonName = nameString.getString();

Let's break this down: 

 JSONObject rootObject = (JSONObject) entry;

This casts the root JSONEntry to a JSONObject so that key-value pairs can be accessed later. 

 JSONArray peopleArray = (JSONArray) rootObject.get("people");

This gets the JSONEntry mapped to the key "people" and casts it as a JSONArray so that items can be accessed later. 

 JSONObject firstPersonObject = (JSONObject) peopleArray.get(0);

This gets the first JSONEntry in the array and casts it as a JSONObject because that is the type of the array item. 

 JSONString nameString = (JSONString) firstPersonObject.get("name");

This gets the value mapped to the key "name" and casts it as a JSONString, since the value is a JSON string. 

 String firstPersonName = nameString.getString();

This gets the name of the first person in the array of people, as a String, through the getString() method of JSONString.

Data can be extracted through this method, but it is tedious and slightly unintuitive, so it is recomended that data is deserialized through JSONDeserializer to convert JSON data to Java data.

See Also:
JSON

    • toJSONText

      public abstract String toJSONText​(int indentLevel, int jsonFormat)
      Generates a String that represents this JSON entry as properly spaced and indented JSON text that can be saved to a file.
      Parameters:
      indentLevel - the amount of levels of indent; used internally to determine how many spaces to place before text on newlines
      jsonFormat - formatting data used when generating text (see JSONFormat)
      Returns:
      a String representing this JSON entry

    • toJSONText

      public String toJSONText​(int jsonFormat)
      Generates a String that represents this JSON entry as a properly spaced and indented JSON text that can be saved to a file. An indent level of 0 will be used.
      Parameters:
      jsonFormat - formatting data used when generating text (see JSONFormat)
      Returns:
      a String representing this JSON entry

    • toJSONText

      public String toJSONText()
      Generates a String that represents this JSON entry as a properly spaced and indented JSON text that can be saved to a file. An indent level of 0 and default format options will be used.
      Returns:
      a String representing this JSON entry

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this JSONEntry, using the default format options. This is identical to: 
       getJSONText(0, new JSONFormat())
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      this JSONEntry as a String
